meanings.sent1: I will prefund the project to ensure it starts on time.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to prefund large expenses to avoid delays.
meanings.sent3: The company decided to prefund the team outing to guarantee everyone could attend.
meanings.sent4: Prefunding the trip felt like buying a ticket to an exciting adventure.
meanings.sent5: She prefunded her savings account to prepare for unexpected emergencies.

meanings.definition: To set aside money for future use.
meanings.sent1: We should prefund our vacation fund to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: Many people prefund their retirement accounts to secure their future.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would prefund his candy stash for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Prefunding the college fund was like planting seeds for a fruitful harvest.
meanings.sent5: She decided to prefund her dream home fund to make it a reality sooner.
